description:
Bring all the songbirds to your yard

Sunflower seeds attract more songbirds than any other type of bird feed—and this bag is 100% sunflower! It’s also made purely of sunflower meats, with no shell to take up space or leave messy hulls on the ground. With the lack of mess, it’s perfect for feeding from balconies and decks in urban areas. Bonus? It’s made without any added synthetics, chemicals, or artificial flavors.

Attracts: cardinals, titmice, chickadees, goldfinches, juncos, sparrows, buntings, wrens, grosbeaks, woodpeckers, towhees, and more

sections.faq:
What birds will enjoy this feed?
Attracts all sunflower-loving birds including bluebirds, chickadees, cardinals, Pyrrhuloxia, titmice, finches, woodpeckers, wrens, buntings, grosbeaks, towhees, nuthatches, song sparrows, and doves.
When is the best time to feed wild birds?
Anytime is a good time to feed birds! However, it is really helpful to supplement our feathered backyard friends with bird seed during migration and winter seasons. This is when they are expending lots of energy traveling long distances, working to retain heat and there may be additional food scarcity.
What is the best feeder to use with this seed?
Any type of seed feeder, but particularly tube feeders, chalet or hopper feeders, and platform feeders.
How often do I need to refill a bird feeder with wild bird seed?
As often as you need or desire. However, we recommend checking your feeder every week.
How do I fill and mix seeds for a feeder?
Use this seed as a single premium seed or mix seeds to create a custom mix. Fill your bird feeder so it can close properly and refill biweekly to weekly (as needed). Clean up spills when filling feeders or underneath feeders as needed.
Where is the best placement for a bird feeder in my yard?
Install at least 10-12 ft from home structure, windows, or potential collisions. Consider squirrel deterrents like squirrel baffles, especially if the feeder is attached or located in a tree.
Where should I store this bird seed?
We recommend storing the bird seed in a closed container within a dry, cool location. This storage will avoid unwanted pests and issues with seed spoiling due to moisture.
What’s the best way to attract birds to my backyard?
Birds may not show up immediately after placing seed, feeders, or houses in your yard. They need the right habitat to feel safe and avoid conflicts with potential predators—so adding plants to your backyard that offer perching, shelter, nesting, or foraging habitat will encourage birds to use feeders and houses. Adding some sort of water feature—especially moving water—will encourage birds to find your backyard too.
Are there any US states or territories where [product] is not approved for use?
HI
